Member Function Documentation

bool jmhUtilities::caseInsCharCompareN ( char  a,
char  b 
)
inlinestatic

Compare two characters in a case-insensitive manner by converting them both to uppercase and then testing if they are equal.

Parameters
athe first character to compare
bthe second character to compare
Returns
true if the two uppercase characters are equal, false otherwise
See also
https://www.safaribooksonline.com/library/view/c-cookbook/0596007612/ch04s14.html
bool jmhUtilities::caseInsCompare ( const string &  s1,
const string &  s2 
)
static

Compare two strings in a case-insensitive manner using the companion case-insensitive character comparison helper function.

Parameters
s1the first string to compare
s2the second string to compare
Returns
true if the two uppercase strings are equal, false otherwise
See also
https://www.safaribooksonline.com/library/view/c-cookbook/0596007612/ch04s14.html
string jmhUtilities::trim ( string  str)
static

Trim leading and trailing white space (spaces, tabs, and newlines) from the string passed as an argument and return the trimmed string. This version is more sophisticated than the one above. It uses iterators and an improved search technique.

Parameters
strstring to trim (a copy, so that the original is not destroyed)
Returns
a copy of the original string with leading and trailing white space removed
